metadata.name: Construction
metadata.description:
THE ROTATED IMAGE  
Realism is a complete and complex painting system in which all the means that one uses have meaning and purpose.  
However, the complexity, system and rules lead to similar results, which can often diverge from what the author originally wanted to express.  
Therefore, realists later often look for ways to free themselves from the system, to reduce and throw away, or to forget.

I don't want to leave the rich language of realism, so I change the context of its reading.  
The image may look abstract, like a cluster of random spots, but  
all created with a clear goal and have a precise shape.
